jx.jx_en_mean: To make or become angry or irritated.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使沮丧，惹恼：使呈现或变得愤怒或恼怒

jx.jx_en_mean: [usu. as adj. browned off]make someone feel irritated or depressed

lj.lj_ly: they are getting browned off with the overtime.
lj.lj_ls: 他们正为加班而沮丧呢。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  brūm, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bruin and German braun

entry.def: Something that is brown is the colour of earth or of wood.

example.ex: The stairs are decorated in golds and earthy browns.
example.tran: 楼梯油漆成金色和土褐色。

entry.tran: 皮肤晒成棕色的；皮肤晒黑的
entry.def: You can describe a white-skinned person as brown when they have been sitting in the sun until their skin has become darker than usual.

example.ex: I don't want to be really really brown, just have a nice light golden colour.
example.tran: 我不想晒得黝黑，只想晒成一种漂亮的淡金色。

entry.def: If someone browns in the sun they become brown in colour.

example.ex: Her skin was of the fortunate kind that could brown in the sun without burning...
example.tran: 她的皮肤属于那种很幸运的类型，在阳光下无需长时间晒着就能变黑。

example.ex: There were many gorgeous females busy browning themselves.
example.tran: 有许多漂亮的女性忙着晒黑自己。

entry.def: A brown person is someone who belongs to a race of people who have brown-coloured skins.

example.ex: ...a slim brown man with a speckled turban.
example.tran: 一个戴着花头巾、身材瘦削、棕色皮肤的男子

entry.def: Brown is used to describe grains that have not had their outer layers removed, and foods made from these grains.

example.ex: ...spicy tomato sauce served over a bed of brown rice.
example.tran: 浇在一层糙米上的辣味番茄酱

entry.tran: （用旺火把)(食物)烤得焦黄；（把…）炸成焦黄色
entry.def: When food browns or when you brown food, you cook it, usually for a short time on a high flame.

example.ex: Cook for ten minutes until the sugar browns...
example.tran: 熬煮10分钟，直到糖变成褐色。

example.ex: He browned the chicken in a frying pan.
example.tran: 他用煎锅把鸡肉煎成焦黄色。

means.word_mean: 1. an orange of low brightness and saturation
1. fry in a pan until it changes color;
1. of a color similar to that of wood or earth

example.en: Musically …to break time out of tempos is to brown off.
example.zh: 就音乐方面来说…拍子脱离节奏就是出错。

list.explanation: 使某人生气，惹恼怒某人

example.en: What he did really browned me off.
example.zh: 他的所作所为确实让我气恼。

example.en: I'm afraid I'm going to brown off everyone，but here goes anyway.
example.zh: 恐怕我会得罪大家，但是不管怎么样，我还是得这么做.。
